Terrorism case starting now
Another case that will be decided soon is the case against a now 16-year-old man, N.T., who is currently being held in surrogate custody in a youth institution. According to Redox, the case against him is based primarily on material obtained from chat channels on Telegram. The court case started earlier this week, on March 14th.
He is accused of violating terrorism legislation by being â€œrecruited to the terrorist organisation Feuerkrieg Division by, among other things, on 11 December 2021, sending an application form for enrolment in the Feuerkrieg Division, in which the defendant stated that he had weapons training and knowledge of explosives as well as knowledge of the ideology behind the Feuerkrieg Division, and then assumed a leading role in the Feuerkrieg Division,â€ as it reads in the indictment.

AWD and FKD
The Atomwaffen Division (AWD) is a network consisting of a number of terrorist cells around the world. The AWD is inspired, among other things, by â€˜The Orderâ€™. Founded by Brandon Russell in 2013, AWD emerged from the Nazi forum Iron March, which closed down in 2018.
The Atomwaffen Division wants to break down society and bring about a kind of apocalypse, and then build a new fascist society based on â€˜white supremacyâ€™. They do not believe that it is possible to achieve this goal through mass movements. Instead, they believe that individual acts of violence and terrorism, especially against ethnic and religious minority groups, are the only ways to create a different society from the existing one.
AWD has attracted mainly younger men, many of them with a military background. They have declared that their members cannot simply be activists in the digital world, but instead must carry out acts of violence in the physical world.
SÃ¥dan ser Atomwaffen Divisions flag ud.
The Feuerkrig Division is a direct offshoot of the Atomwaffen Division (AWD) and was founded in 2018. It has the same ideological foundation as the AWD. The groupâ€™s gathering point is primarily the internet, while members call on each other to carry out acts of violence in the physical world.
In their online forums, members share terrorist manuals, texts on fascist ideology and lists of potential targets. The group has particularly attracted very young boys. An underage Estonian boy who called himself â€˜The Commanderâ€™ was arrested in 2020 for planning attacks on Jewish schools and the killing of Jewish children.
The sharing of terrorist manuals and membersâ€™ support for terrorist acts has led to both AWD and FKD being listed as terrorist organisations in the UK.
SÃ¥dan ser Feuerkreig Divisions flag ud.

He is also charged with attempting to recruit a friend of a similar age into the Feuerkrieg Division, which failed when the two were arrested.
The third and final charge under the terrorism section is â€œpromoting the activities of the terrorist organisation Feuerkrieg Divisionâ€. This relates to six different situations where, in the period from December 2021 to April 2022, he repeatedly shared links to folders containing bomb and weapons material and â€˜militant extremist materialâ€™, as well as instructing others on how the Feuerkrieg Division should organise itself in a cell structure. He also, still according to the indictment, contributed to the preparation of the Feuerkrieg Divisionâ€™s internal handbook, which, among other things, deals with the groupâ€™s operational security and contains â€œincitement to commit terrorismâ€.
In addition to the three counts of violation of terrorism legislation, N.T. is charged with possession of a dagger with a 16-centimetre blade.
During the search of his familyâ€™s home, several ammunition boxes were found containing, among other things, neckties, rope, camouflage clothing, a compass, Nazi flags, Nazi armbands, Adolf Hitlerâ€™s book Mein Kampf and the book Turner Diaries, which can best be described as a right-wing terrorist manual. We will come back to that.
The then 15-year-old boy also had a Feuerkrieg Division flag lying around.
N.T. and his friend were both arrested in April last year and brought before a preliminary hearing. However, the friend was not kept in custody and has not been charged in the case.
The trial against N.T. started on Tuesday 14 March and will run until the end of May. When the case is finalised, he will have been in custody for just over a year.
The manual
The fact that the book The Turner Diaries was found at N.T. is not a big surprise if you are familiar with the radical right. It has a cult status among the most militant nazis.




The Turner Diaries is a fictional novel written by neo-Nazi leader William Luther Pierce and published under the pseudonym Andrew Macdonald in 1978. The author was active, first in the American Nazi Party and later in his own organisation, the National Alliance, which called for the genocide of Jews and other minority groups. Pierce was an active Nazi until his death in 2002.
The novel, written in the form of a diary, describes the actions and thoughts of the protagonist, Earl Turner, about a fascist uprising in the United States. Among other things, Earl Turnerâ€™s group attacks the US Parliament, an episode that in many ways resembles the attack on the Capitol by Trump supporters in January 2021. Earl Turner describes that the violent attacks are intended to mobilise other supporters of an ethnically homogeneous white nation and ignite a fascist revolution and a global genocide of minority groups and political opponents.
As both the United States and several European countries experienced a wave of Nazi terror in the nineties, The Turner Diaries was a key source of inspiration, promoted by the Blood & Honour network, among others. Since then, the book has had a quiet existence, but in recent years it has been revitalised and is frequently shared on Telegram channels and other social media sites.
Since its publication, the book has inspired numerous fascist terrorist attacks and hate crimes, so much so that the FBI has referred to it as â€˜the bible of the racist rightâ€™. For example, in the 1995 Oklohoma City bombing, Timothy McVeigh, in collusion with Terry Nichols, detonated a car bomb in front of a building housing several government agencies. In Timothy McVeighâ€™s car, extracts of the Turner Diaries were found. 168 people were killed by the car bomb. Both McVeigh and Terry Nichols were military veterans.
The American Nazi terror group The Order was also inspired by the book. The group was active in 1983-1984 and was based on a mixture of Christian fanaticism and Nazi ideals. The groupâ€™s name was originally â€˜BrÃ¼der Schweigenâ€™ (The Silent Brotherhood), but due to its similarities to the organisation â€˜The Orderâ€™ in the book Turner Diaries, the organisation became widely known as The Order.
The Order was responsible for a series of robberies and later at least two murders: one on the nazi Walter West, who they believed to be an informer, and the other on the Jewish journalist Alan Berg. Alan Berg was a radio host who was outspoken in his criticism of the activities of far-right groups. After the killing of Alan Berg, police found a list of other targets of the group, but The Order was stopped before they could carry out any more attacks.
it is a book from which National Socialists can learn much
The Turner Diaries has gained popularity in recent years, including in several Danish Nazi telegram channels. However, the book is also celebrated in more formal contexts. In June 2020, the Nazi organisation NMR, which outwardly has made much of an effort towards being a legal and legitimate organisation â€“ despite the fact that leading members of the organisation have been convicted in several serious cases â€“ published a review of the book. Among other things, it said:
â€œIn addition to being a well-written and exciting story full of precise political analysis and interesting ideological reasoning, it is a book from which National Socialists can learn much. The first is how the Organisation operates: There is an outward-looking part that deals with popular education and open recruitment. This part of the Organisation doesnâ€™t come across very well in the book, as Turner and the people he lives and works with donâ€™t really have much to do with it. They belong to an underground, militant part of the Organisation, living in small fighting groups in the shadows. These groups have no contact with the open part and very limited contact with each other. Orders come from the top of the hierarchy, often without further explanation or motivation as to why a particular mission needs to be carried out. In more than one case, Mr Turner is actually very critical of the orders he receives. Despite this, he is unquestionably loyal, and eventually, when he sees the effects of these activities in their entirety, he realises their necessity.â€
The review on the NMR website was published under the headline â€˜The white race strikes backâ€™.
Telegram as a safe harbour
That far-right and Nazi groups have used the internet and social media as primary recruitment tools since the turn of the millennium is well documented and needs no further introduction.
What has happened in recent years, however, is that most major social media platforms are cracking down harder on the spread of racist and Nazi propaganda on their platforms. As a result, major platforms such as Facebook, Twitter and Instagram are rarely the preferred choice when neo-Nazis want to gather digitally. Similarly, they have, to a certain extent, been removed from many other platforms, such as WhatsApp and Discord, which have been popular with the far-right in recent years.
As a result, Telegram has recently become the main platform for sharing motivational quotes from Hitler, anti-Semitic memes and terrorist manuals. This is true both internationally and in Denmark.
In Denmark, there are somewhere between five and ten active channels on Telegram, where mainly young neo-Nazis and sympathisers gather and chat. What is common to the different channels is an open fascination with violence and weapons, a positive view of Hitler, the Holocaust and genocide, and a desire to do something. The channels are run by different individuals â€“ in the case of the NMR channel, an organisation â€“ who from time to time have conflicts with each other. Some users are even bullied by other users, but there is an overlap between the different active channels. Many users are active on several or most of the Telegram channels.
In addition to the NMR channel, two of the central channels are â€˜Danmarks Nationale TGâ€™ and â€˜FÃ¦drelandsfrontenâ€™. Both channels have recently been closed and have been reopened under new names.
â€œI have a recipe for a bombâ€
FÃ¦drelandsfronten has existed since December 2022 and consists mainly of very young men and boys who openly want to use violence in their fight against, among others, Jewish and Muslim citizens, who, along with the LGBTQ community, are identified as some of the â€˜enemiesâ€™.
I am willing to kill a Jew if I am paid 1000 dkk
For example, 15-year-old A.L. wrote in a debate in FÃ¦drelandsfronten during the Christmas holidays:
â€œMaybe we should have the 6 million gassed as they say we have already doneâ€.
Six million refers to the six million Jews murdered during the Holocaust. He continues: â€œI am willing to kill a Jew if I am paid 1000 dkkâ€.
However, A.L. is not alone in his extreme hatred towards Jews in the group. The user Palladius is also an active participant:
â€œI have a recipe for a bomb if we need itâ€.
Frederik SÃ¸e Antvorskov Larsen hides behind the username Palladius. In 2021, he completed his military service in the Royal Guard. There he received the basic training of the Danish Defence, which includes training with firearms and explosives.
Later, both Frederik SÃ¸e Antvorskov Larsen and A.L. share pictures of themselves on the Telegram channel, partly masked, doing the nazi salute. A.L. subsequently posts another photo of himself; a dagger with the Star of David on it. The caption reads:
â€œWeapons reavel so they know to be afraidâ€. (It should probably read â€˜revealâ€™).
In February this year, he did a weekâ€™s internship in the armed forces, specifically at Naval Station Frederikshavn.
On Telegram, he writes that he â€œbecame a Nazi when I was 13â€ and â€œI have been a racist all my lifeâ€. A.L. is a 15-year-old boy from North Jutland. Redox is aware of his identity, but due to his young age and the fact that, according to our information, he is already in contact with the authorities, we have chosen not to publish his full name in this article.
Itâ€™s better to go to jail than to be victimised
However, this is not the only time knives are mentioned in the chat channel. For example, user â€œSir Johnâ€ encourages A.L. to carry a knife. He writes: â€œYou might as well start carrying a knife. Itâ€™s better to go to jail than to be victimisedâ€. To this, A.L. replies that he already carries a knife occasionally.

From the street to the chat
Nazi interest in weapons and explosives is nothing new. In the nineties, there were several serious cases regarding bombs and weapons in Denmark, the worst of course being the letter bomb that murdered a young socialist in NÃ¸rrebro on 16 March 1992. In 1997, the Combat 18 terrorist group from Copenhagen sent three letter bombs, all aimed at its enemies. However, the bombs were intercepted by the police.
In the 2000s untill the mid-2010s, the Danish Nazi movement was very much focussed on taking to the streets. Both in the form of demonstrations and actions, but also to have confrontations with political opponents on the left and to attack minority groups. For a period of 20-25 years, the majority of Nazi violence consisted of street attacks and vandalism.
Since the mid-2010s, there has been a slow shift, which has so far culminated in the years during and after the coronavirus lockdowns. Neo-Nazis are much less likely to take to the streets as a group, but instead gather online. From there, some of them are radicalised and inspired to prepare or commit extremely violent crimes.
the most likely right-wing extremist terrorist attack in Denmark is an attack carried out by a lone terrorist
In March last year, PETâ€™s Centre for Terror Analysis (CTA) published a new and comprehensive analysis of the risk of terrorist attacks in Denmark. Among other things, the report states:
â€œCTA assesses that the most likely right-wing extremist terrorist attack in Denmark is an attack carried out by a lone terrorist, but it may also be carried out by a small group of individuals (â€¦) CTA assesses that the right-wing extremist terrorist threat in Denmark reflects the general development among right-wing extremists in the West, insofar as it primarily derives from individuals on the periphery of or outside the established physical right-wing extremist organisations and groups, whose radicalisation primarily takes place in virtual communities of interest. It is less likely that a terrorist attack will be planned in connection to the physical far-right organisations and groups in Denmark.â€
The March 2022 CTA analysis comes on the back of the far-right terrorist attacks that hit several locations around the world from 2019-2021, for example Christchurch in New Zealand, Halle in Germany, as well as a number of other locations.
Fascination with terrorism
â€œWhatever is gonna happen I will just say that I have been honoured to have been here on Telegram with you. I have talked with young and old. Experienced and unexperienced. I have talked with the oldest and most experienced in this struggle â€“ The most respected. I have been a part of creating white unity among our people, better than any jew could ever hope to network with any other jew! I hope this chaos of life will continue and you here.
White revolution starts with youâ€¦ Network!â€
This is what JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac wrote on Telegram in October 2022. For the past handful of years, he has been active on the far right, where he has had dealings with several different organisations. Today, he runs one of the largest far-right Telegram channels, where he regularly shares Nazi material.
JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac became active in the far-right movement in Denmark in 2017, when he helped Rasmus Paludan and Stram Kurs (â€œHard Lineâ€) distribute election material during the municipal elections that autumn.
JÃ©rÃ©my Meilhac (med rÃ¸d â€˜Make America Great Againâ€™-kasket) ses her sammen med Rasmus Paludan, partilederen for Stram Kurs, under med et valgfremstÃ¸d pÃ¥ Christianshavns Torv i oktober 2017. (Foto: Researchkollektivet Redox)
The following year, he was arrested in a major police operation. There were fears that he would carry out a school shooting at Sydkystens Gymnasium, a high school in IshÃ¸j, because he had written â€œCalm before the stormâ€ in a Facebook post. Heavily armed police officers arrested him, and in the subsequent trial he was convicted of racist threats against a teacher at the high school, but not of planning school shootings â€“ he was neither charged nor indicted for that.
The threats involved him using a fake Facebook profile to comment on a photograph of the teacher with the text: â€œNo, they are fucking â€œperkereâ€ (Red. a Danish derogatory term for people from the middle east) and they must dieâ€. He was sentenced to 40 days in prison.
Since then, JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac has been involved in several organisations, including the Nordic Resistance Movement and the newly founded right-wing radical association Folkets Flamme.
However, his main activities take place online.
Today, JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac runs a number of Telegram channels where he has shares everything from speeches by Adolf Hitler and Hermann GÃ¶ring to Nazi rock and propaganda for Nazi terrorist groups.
For example, he has shared a number of videos from the terrorist organisation Atomwaffen Division and tribute songs for the Combat 18 terrorist group. He has also shared glorifying images and texts about Timothy McVeigh, who was responsible for the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing that killed 168 people, and the German Nazi terrorist organisation NSU, which was responsible for numerous racially motivated killings.







JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac shares a photo of the only living member of the German Nazi terrorist group NSU, Beate ZschÃ¤pe, with the caption "Action Over Words".
JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac shares a photo of the only living member of the German Nazi terrorist group NSU, Beate ZschÃ¤pe, with the caption "Action Over Words".

Next



On the Telegram channel, JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac also shares summaries of what he calls â€œWhite Terrorâ€, listing Nazi and racist terrorist attacks. Among other things, he indicates which weapons were used and how many people were killed in the attacks.
Many of the posts on the Telegram channel are accompanied by disclaimers in which he formally disclaims responsibility for the content of his posts and states that he does not incite violence:
â€œThis channel and every one associated with it, DONâ€™T encourage white terror or mass murder. We simply share this content for purpose of documenting history, satire & artâ€.
The largest of his Telegram channels is called â€œJÃˆRÃˆMYS BUNKERâ€. It has existed for two years and now has more than 900 followers. He has posted thousands of videos, photos and songs.
every little thing we do actually accelerates this revolution
In between worshipping historical Nazis and right-wing terrorists, JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac occasionally writes more ideological posts himself. He emphasizes that his readers need to realise that they have a responsibility to change the course of history.
â€œI sometime think that it is because of the anti-white elite getting afraid, that they allow talk like this, as to â€œeaseâ€ the masses. Also I believe that the overton window is changing generally. All of this is happening because some people started talking about the problems, and that that talk spread. Every true revolution starts from the bottom of a society. It may sound stupid, but every little thing we do actually accelerates this revolutionâ€.
In addition to running his own channels, JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac has also been active in the NMRâ€™s chat channels, FÃ¦drelandsfronten and Danmarks Nationale TG. In FÃ¦drelandsfronten, he has previously shared The Turner Diaries.
He has also counselled the young A.L. on the acquisition of a mask, and when A.L. writes â€œI will fight to the deathâ€, JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac replies â€œYes, but be careful with such statementsâ€.
However, sharing terrorist propaganda has not made JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac popular in all circles. On the Telegram channel â€œDanmarks Nationale TGâ€, he has become unpopular with several users who have strongly criticised him, calling him a â€˜PET (red. Danish Secret Service) magnetâ€™ and a â€˜Fed-posterâ€™, a term used to describe sharing material that attracts the attention of the authorities and may result in repression.
The other members believe that JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhacâ€™s sharing of terrorist manifestos, videos and books could lead to increased surveillance and reprisals, which they want to avoid. One person on the channel â€œDanmarks Nationale TGâ€ wrote directly that JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac was partly responsible for teenagers being charged in court after being inspired by his material. This was in response to an article on the Feuerkrieg Division case, which started Tuesday.
The criticism of JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac turned into personal attacks and outright bullying. He was eventually excluded from the Telegram channel.
the sharing of material has exclusively historical, artistic and satirical purposes
JÃ©rÃ©my replied the following to Redox:
â€œItâ€™s also a pity for you that you canâ€™t read properly, as when it is constantly explicitly pointed out that the sharing of material has exclusively historical, artistic and satirical purposes. It was one of the first things I wrote about myself and the channels I have on Telegram.â€
JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac shared an audio file on Telegram following Redoxâ€™s enquiry. It is a kind of far-right radio play called â€˜The Diary of Jonni Hansenâ€™, produced by members of the Nazi alt-right. In the clip, Redox editor Simon BÃ¼nger is killed by a Nazi.
NMR behind the scenes
The example of JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhac shows that it is not only teenagers who are active on the FÃ¦drelandsfronten Telegram channel. User names such as â€˜The Nationalist from Denmarkâ€™, â€˜Oswald Mosleyâ€™ and â€˜Adolf Eichmannâ€™ also include members of the Nazi organisation the Nordic Resistance Movement, which has branches throughout the Nordic region.
Members of the organisation have been convicted several times in the past for serious violence and murder, as well as for building firearms and bombs.
One of the organisationâ€™s Danish branch leaders has been in prison in recent years, serving a three-year sentence for attempting to build a bomb and a firearm. You can read much more about that case here (The article is in Danish).
In the FÃ¦drelandsfronten channel, NMR members have both asked critical questions and tried to recruit new members. The user Palladius â€“ the one with the bomb recipe â€“ says that he puts up NMR stickers, and he has also described in the NMR channel that he has previously applied for membership of the NMR.
Jacob Vullum Andersen, now the former head of the Danish branch of the NMR, is one of those who have been active in the telegram channel of FÃ¦drelandsfronten, even after he left the NMR in January this year. As recently as February, he used the channel to sell several items, including a bulletproof vest and various Nazi memorabilia.

Redox says: There is cause for concern
The developments we have seen in the last few years should set alarm bells ringing. First the case where an NMR branch leader tried to produce both a bomb and firearms in his home, then the arrests in the Feuerkrieg Division case, and now the Ukrainian Naziâ€™s alleged plans to attack Cafe Sappho in Aarhus. It is not business as usual.
We have long been pleased that the street violence that characterised the late 1990s, 2000s and early 2010s has been in marked retreat, but now it seems to have been replaced by a very different and potentially much more dangerous strategy.
The risk of a one-man Nazi terrorist attack is a very real risk today.

Reprisals
The chat on the original FÃ¦drelandsfronten telegram channel has now gone silent. A.L. has said that he was called to a meeting with the police after his classmates warned the school that he might commit acts of violence. Subsequently, A.L.â€™s parents also became aware of his activities and his mobile phone was confiscated. Other members set up a new channel without A.L.â€™s participation.
Tuesday, the trial against N.T. started at the court in HolbÃ¦k. It will take place before a jury, which means that the prosecution will demand a minimum of four years in prison. His lawyer has not responded to Redoxâ€™s enquiry.
It has not been possible to contact the Ukrainian Nazi D.C. Neither Jacob Vullum Andersen nor Frederik SÃ¸e Antvorskov Larsen have responded to our enquiries. Hanne Kronborg, who sits on the board of Folkets Flamme, does not wish to comment on her or the organisationâ€™s views on JÃ©rÃ©my Trebbien Meilhacâ€™s activities on Telegram.
Thursday this week is 16 March. It is the commemoration day of the bombing in SÃ¸llerÃ¸dgade, which in 1992 cost the young socialist Henrik Christensen his life. To mark the occasion, anti-fascist groups have called for a memorial demonstration in SÃ¸llerÃ¸dgade in NÃ¸rrebro. It will take place on Thursday at 17.00.
Remember that you can support our research work. You can send a one-off donation to Mobilepay 80905. If you want to help us secure a steady, stable income, you can become a supporting member (www.redox.dk/support). It only costs 50 DKK per month. The money primarily covers our running costs for court books, camera equipment, IT and transport.
excerpt: He wore a gold ring on his finger, engraved with a large swastika. According to the indictment, the Ukrainian Nazi D.C. sought knowledge on how to make firebombs and instructions on knife fighting before going to â€˜CafÃ© Sapphoâ€™ in Aarhus a few days later. The cafÃ© is, in their own words, an â€œassociation and social â€¦

title: Presset skÃ¦rpet pÃ¥ nyfascister efter forbud mod Generation Identitaire
content:
Den franske moderorganisation for den identitÃ¦re bevÃ¦gelse, Generation Identitaire, er blevet gjort forbudt og oplÃ¸st ved dekret. Det skete onsdag i sidste uge. Det var den franske indenrigsminister, GÃ©rald Darmanin, der pÃ¥ Twitter publicerede et dekret, der forbÃ¸d den nyfascistiske organisation. Teksten slÃ¥r blandt andet fast, at Generation Identitaire er blevet forbudt fordi, de efter de franske myndigheders opfattelse, har opfordret til â€diskrimination, had og voldâ€.
I oktober 2020 protesterede Generation IdentitÃ¦r mod Hizb ut-Tahrirs demonstration ved den franske ambasade pÃ¥ Kongens Nytorv i KÃ¸benhavn. Den meget aktive aktivist Sigfred Agerbo Jensen ses her i midten.
Forbuddet har rÃ¸dder tilbage til 2017. Dengang indledte Generation Identitaire kampagnen â€Forsvar Europaâ€. I den fÃ¸rste stÃ¸rre aktion sendte bevÃ¦gelsen sine aktivister pÃ¥ bÃ¥d ud i Middelhavet. FormÃ¥let var at blokere flygtninges vej over det farefulde vand.
Ã…ret efter gennemfÃ¸rte Generation Identitaire en storstilet aktion i Alperne pÃ¥ grÃ¦nsen mellem Frankrig og Italien. FormÃ¥let med aktionen var igen at blokere grÃ¦nseovergange for flygtninge. Generation Identitaire havde ifÃ¸lge Reuters lejet to helikoptere og et fly til lejligheden, og formÃ¥let var at lokalisere og stoppe flygtninge.
OgsÃ¥ i januar i Ã¥r bevÃ¦gede organisationen sig op i bjergene. Igen var formÃ¥let at blokere en grÃ¦nseovergang og hindre den pÃ¥stÃ¥ede â€terror- og migranttrusselâ€. Denne gang var det bare i PyrenÃ¦erne, ved grÃ¦nseovergangen mellem Frankrig og Spanien. Det var denne seneste aktion, der fik bÃ¦geret til at flyde over for de franske myndigheder og som fik den franske indenrigsminister til at udtale, at medlemmer af gruppen arbejder for en â€underminering af Republikkenâ€ og at de tilmed â€underminerer demokratiet, nÃ¥r de agerer grÃ¦nsepolitiâ€. PÃ¥ den baggrund igangsatte indenrigsministeren i januar 2021 en undersÃ¸gelse, der skulle fastslÃ¥ om Generation Identitaire kunne forbydes.
En anden Ã¥rsag til forbuddet mod Generation Identitaire er eftervirkningerne af Al Jazeeras undersÃ¸gende dokumentar, Generation Hate, fra december 2018. Dokumentaren dokumenterede bÃ¥de voldsparathed, Hitler-sympatier og stÃ¦rke forbindelser mellem det stÃ¸rste hÃ¸jreradikale parti i Frankrig, Rassemblement national (tidligere Front National), med Marine Le Pen i spidsen og miljÃ¸et omkring Generation Identitaire.
Brev til Generation Identitaire
Med indenrigsministeren i spidsen fulgte de franske myndigheder den 11. februar 2021 op pÃ¥ den indledende undersÃ¸gelse fra januar. Indenrigsministeren sendte sÃ¥ledes et brev til Generation Identitaires ledelse. I brevet henviser han til, at Al Jazeeras dokumentar havde afslÃ¸ret Generation Identitaires sande ansigt og skriver desuden, at Generation Identitaire benytter â€Ã¥benlys hadefuld retorikâ€, at Generation Identitaire â€bidrager til hÃ¸jnelsen af spÃ¦ndinger i samfundetâ€ og at organisationen â€fremprovokerer voldelige angrebâ€. Generation Identitaire fik derefter 10 dage til at svare, skrev indenrigsministeren pÃ¥ Twitter.
Generation Identitaires svar gjorde ikke indtryk pÃ¥ de franske myndigheder og onsdag den 3. marts blev bevÃ¦gelsen forbudt.
Forbud giver genlyd i Danmark
Allerede fÃ¸r forbuddet mod Generation Identitaire blev en realitet, gav processen, der ledte op til forbuddet mod den franske moderorganisation, genlyd ind i den danske gren af den hÃ¸jreradikale bevÃ¦gelse.
Den danske afdeling, Generation IdentitÃ¦r, har fulgt udviklingen i Frankrig tÃ¦t. I en artikel pÃ¥ hjemmesiden fra den 22. februar 2021 kaldes der pÃ¥ solidaritet med Generation Identitaire. To dage tidligere har det, de selv beskriver som â€œen stor gruppe danske identitÃ¦re aktivisterâ€ deltaget i en protestdemonstration i Paris, selvom der er omfattende restriktioner i begge lande. FormÃ¥let var at vise stÃ¸tte til den franske moderorganisation.
Foran den franske ambassade ses fra hÃ¸jre Generation IdentitÃ¦r-aktivisterne Emil Naundrup Vester, AsbjÃ¸rn Magnus Voetmann og Sebastian Nielsen under aktionen i oktober.
Det er langt fra fÃ¸rste gang Generation IdentitÃ¦r besÃ¸ger deres franske ligesindede. Tidligere har danskerne deltaget i bÃ¥de sommerlejre og andre aktiviteter i Frankrig.
Redox har tidligere omtalt hvordan en stor del af Generation IdentitÃ¦rs indsamlede midler via â€Foreningen til bevarelse af EuropÃ¦isk identitetâ€, som Generation IdentitÃ¦r har sat op til formÃ¥let, gÃ¥r til rejser til udlandet.
I det seneste regnskab, der dÃ¦kker perioden 1. august 2019 til 31. juli 2020, fremgÃ¥r det, at bevÃ¦gelsen i Danmark har indsamlet 337.266 kr. Det er en lille stigning i indsamlede midler sammenlignet med Ã¥ret fÃ¸r. Midlerne er indsamlet â€fra private bidragsydere og virksomhederâ€, som det lyder i rapporten.
Kigges der nÃ¦rmere pÃ¥ regnskabet bliver det meget tydeligt, at en stor del af Generation IdentitÃ¦rs politiske virksomhed handler om at pleje de internationale kontakter. StÃ¸rstedelen af udgifterne er brugt pÃ¥ â€materialerâ€, men pÃ¥ andenpladsen i forhold til udgifter kommer â€rejseomkostningerâ€. Af de indsamlede midler har Generation IdentitÃ¦r brugt 86.386 kr. pÃ¥ at rejse rundt til politisk ligesindede i Europa i indsamlingsperioden. Det svarer til en tredjedel af samtlige afholdte udgifter i regnskabet.
Foragt for det liberale demokrati
I en tekst fra den 16. februar skriver Generation IdentitÃ¦r i en lÃ¦ngere kommentar til udviklingen i Frankrig under overskriften â€œDet liberale demokratis fallitâ€, at situationen i Frankrig viser, at â€œâ€¦at den demokratiske pluralisme ikke gÃ¦lder for hÃ¸jreflÃ¸jen, og udstiller det liberale demokratis kriseâ€.
Senere i artiklen spekuleres der over hvad konsekvenserne ved et forbud kan vÃ¦re. Her mener Generation IdentitÃ¦r, at forbuddet kan have den konsekvens, at det vil â€œunderminere tillidenâ€ til det liberale demokrati og dermed â€œtroen pÃ¥ at den demokratiske vej er en mulighedâ€¦â€.
At foragten for det liberale demokrati ikke er blevet mindre efter forbuddet blev proklameret den 3. marts bliver tydeligt nÃ¥r man lÃ¦ser Generation IdentitÃ¦rs seneste tekst fra 8. marts.
I artiklen er det ikke lÃ¦ngere kun det liberale demokrati, der er i â€œkriseâ€. Nu proklameres det tilmed, at forbuddet ikke kun viser en demokratisk krise, men at sagen mod Generation Identitaire ligefrem â€œafslÃ¸rer hele liberalismens sammenbrudâ€ og forbuddet er udtryk for â€œliberalismens sidste krampetrÃ¦kningerâ€. I artiklens fÃ¸rste sÃ¦tning slÃ¥r Generation IdentitÃ¦r deres holdning til det liberale demokrati helt fast. Organisationen skriver direkte:
â€œDet liberale, pluralistiske demokrati er en lÃ¸gn.â€
Fra hÃ¸jre ses Generation IdentitÃ¦r-medlemmerne Sebastian Nielsen, Daniel Nordentoft, Morten Christensen og talsmanden Frederik Rye Skov pÃ¥ Kongens Nytorv i oktober.
Inde i den politiske varme
Siden Generation Identitaire blev dannet i Frankrig, har bevÃ¦gelsen spredt sig til en rÃ¦kke lande i Europa, herunder Danmark. Selvom organisationen er forholdsvis lille i Danmark, har de formÃ¥et at etablere sig og skabe et stÃ¦rkt brand via symbolske happenings og aktioner, der filmes og deles pÃ¥ sociale medier. De er ligeledes blevet taget varmt imod af sÃ¦rligt den nationalkonservative hÃ¸jreflÃ¸j, der ser deres den ungdommelige aktivisme som en tiltrÃ¦ngt fornyelse.
Selvom Generation IdentitÃ¦rs talsperson, Aurelija Aniulyte, i Deadline pÃ¥ DR2 snakkede â€blodets bÃ¥ndâ€ som udgangspunkt for â€˜danskhedâ€™, og organisationen ideologisk set er et stykke lÃ¦ngere til hÃ¸jre end kernen af den nationalkonservative bevÃ¦gelse, er Generation IdentitÃ¦r blevet en del af det nationalkonservative miljÃ¸, og har blandt andet vÃ¦ret involveret i Mosbjerg Folkefest. De har holdt tale pÃ¥ Christiansborg, inviteret af Trykkefrihedsselskabet, og en af Generation IdentitÃ¦rs tidligere centrale medlemmer, Jeppe Veibel Jensen, er blevet ansat i Nye Borgerliges sekretariat pÃ¥ Christiansborg.

Nyfascisme?
Generation IdentitÃ¦r udspringer af den hÃ¸jreradikale ideologiske strÃ¸mning, der kalder sig selv Det Nye HÃ¸jre (pÃ¥ fransk: Nouvelle Droite), som opstod i kÃ¸lvandet pÃ¥ Anden Verdenskrig, hvor hÃ¸jreradikalismen og fascismen skulle genopfinde sig selv. Vi bruger betegnelsen nyfascister om Generation IdentitÃ¦r. Du kan lÃ¦se vores analyse her.

Redox har tidligere kunne dokumentere talrige eksempler pÃ¥ omfavnelsen af Generation IdentitÃ¦r fra medlemmer af Dansk Folkeparti, Nye Borgerlige og Stram Kurs. Den nyfascistiske organisation er hurtigt og smidigt blevet accepteret af den parlamentariske hÃ¸jreflÃ¸j som en legitim aktÃ¸r og allieret.
Under pres i flere lande
Den franske moderorganisation er dog langt fra den eneste gren af den identitÃ¦re bevÃ¦gelse, der er under pres i Europa. OgsÃ¥ i lande som Ã˜strig og Tyskland er presset pÃ¥ organisationens lokalafdelinger steget.
I Ã˜strig undersÃ¸ger myndigheder ogsÃ¥ om bevÃ¦gelsen kan forbydes. Det sker pÃ¥ baggrund af en mulig forbindelse til terror efter det kom frem at den hÃ¸jreekstreme terrorist, Brenton Tarrant, der i et terrorangreb drÃ¦bte 51 mennesker i to moskeer i Christchurch, New Zealand, havde vÃ¦ret i kontakt med bevÃ¦gelsens Ã¸strigske leder, Martin Sellner. Brenton Tarrant havde desuden doneret penge til bevÃ¦gelsen. Senere blev det dog slÃ¥et fast, at der ikke nÃ¸dvendigvis var en direkte forbindelse mellem Sellner og Tarrant og sagen blev droppet. Ikke desto mindre har de Ã¸strigske myndigheder fastholdt presset pÃ¥ organisation og undersÃ¸ger fortsat om bevÃ¦gelsen kan oplÃ¸ses i Ã˜strig.
OgsÃ¥ i Tyskland er presset pÃ¥ Generation IdentitÃ¦r stort. Her har efterretningstjenesten klassificeret bevÃ¦gelsen som â€hÃ¸jreekstremisterâ€ og myndighederne har uden held forsÃ¸gt at kriminalisere gruppen.

Hverken Generation IdentitÃ¦rs talsperson Frederik Rye Skov, Sigfred Agerbo Jensen, Daniel Nordentoft, Emil Naundrup Vester, Sebastian Nielsen, AsbjÃ¸rn Magnus Voetmann eller Morten Christensen har besvaret Redoxâ€™ gentagne henvendelser.Â BÃ¥de Frederik Rye Skov, Sigfred Agerbo Jensen, Sebastian Nielsen og Morten Christensen har blokeret Redoxâ€™ journalister pÃ¥ de sociale medier, hvor vi har kontaktet dem.

title: Dansk NMR-leder trÃ¦kker sig: Tilbyder at kaste organisationen ud i â€œintern kaos og svÃ¦kkelseâ€
content:
Martin Durvad, der er den Ã¸verste leder af Den Nordiske ModstandsbevÃ¦gelse (NMR) i Danmark, trÃ¦kker sig nu fra den nazistiske organisation. Samtidig tilbyder han Redox at sende NMR ud i â€œintern kaos og svÃ¦kkelseâ€.
Det sker som direkte konsekvens af fÃ¦ngslingen af Jacob Vullum Andersen efter forrige weekends omfattende aktioner mod jÃ¸der i Danmark.
Der kom en email
Torsdag aften skrev Martin Durvad en email til Redox. I den lÃ¸d det blandt andet:
â€œJeg skriver til jer, da jeg har et forslag der kunne gavne os begge. I lyset af de seneste hÃ¦ndelser, sÃ¥ kan jeg ikke lÃ¦ngere lÃ¦gge navn til den nordske modstandsbevÃ¦gelse. Derfor Ã¸nsker jeg at i fjerner mit navn i jeres artikler, og kan til gengÃ¦ld tilbyde min fulde tilbagetrÃ¦kning. Med hvad det medfÃ¸rer af intern kaos og svÃ¦kkelse her samtidig med Jacobs anholdelse. Jeg vil med et holde mig 100% fra den nationale scene for bestandig. Artiklerne er gamle og ubetydelige. Jeg fjerner selv mit navn fra alle andre steder privat og inde for organisationen.â€
Slettede sit navn
Fredag formiddag kunne Redox konstatere, at Durvad allerede havde vÃ¦ret i sving pÃ¥ NMRâ€™s hjemmeside. I flere artikler, hvor han oprindelig var omtalt med navn, er hans navn nu fjernet. I en artikel fra 2. juni lÃ¸d det oprindeligt:
â€œDet var nu blevet tid til dagens hÃ¸jdepunkt, hvor Den Nordiske ModstandsbevÃ¦gelses danske grens nationale chef, Martin Durvad, skulle tale.â€œ
Fredag lyder teksten i stedet:
â€œDet var nu blevet tid til dagens hÃ¸jdepunkt, hvor Den Nordiske ModstandsbevÃ¦gelses danske grens nationale chef skulle tale.â€
Den oprindelige artikel kan ses pÃ¥ internetarkivet archive.org.
Redox har fundet flere lignende eksempler, hvor Durvad nu har fjernet sit eget navn fra hjemmesiden pÃ¥ en organisation, som han officielt stadig stÃ¥r i spidsen for.
En organisation i knÃ¦
I april gennemfÃ¸rte NMR sin hidtil stÃ¸rste magtdemonstration i Danmark, da de sammen med en stor gruppe svenske nazister marcherede igennem KÃ¸benhavn. Selvom langt hovedparten af de mere end 80 demonstranter var svenskere, sÃ¥ var der ingen tvivl om, at den danske NMR-afdeling oplevede dagen som en stor sejr. Siden da er det gÃ¥et stÃ¦rkt nedad.

Hvorfor efterkommer Redoxâ€™ ikke Martin Durvads Ã¸nske?
Det sker fra tid til anden, at tidligere hÃ¸jreekstremister kontakter os, fordi de gerne vil have fjernet et billede eller deres navn fra en artikel. Det er vi som udgangspunkt Ã¥bne overfor, for vi synes det er positivt, nÃ¥r personer lÃ¦gger de racistiske og nynazistiske miljÃ¸er bag sig. 
SÃ¥dan en forespÃ¸rgsel behandles seriÃ¸st og vi vurderer en lang rÃ¦kke faktorer, blandt andet vedkommendes alder og anciennitet i det nazistiske miljÃ¸ samt hvor lÃ¦nge vedkommende har vÃ¦ret ude af miljÃ¸et. En ung person, der var aktiv i en kortere periode, og som har lagt bevÃ¦gelsen bag sig, vil vi vÃ¦re meget tilbÃ¸jelig til at fjerne. 
Men vi kan, vil og skal ikke omskrive historien. Hvis man har vÃ¦ret nÃ¸glefigur pÃ¥ hÃ¸jreflÃ¸jen, sÃ¥ fÃ¥r man som udgangspunkt ikke fjernet sit navn fra vores artikler. Det er tilfÃ¦ldet med Martin Durvad. Alt andet ville vÃ¦re historierevisionisme.
NÃ¥r lederen af en nazistisk bevÃ¦gelse, der er i offentlighedens sÃ¸gelys pÃ¥ grund af antisemitisk hÃ¦rvÃ¦rk, tilbyder at kaste organisationen ud i â€œintern kaos og svÃ¦kkelseâ€ for til gengÃ¦ld selv at slippe for opmÃ¦rksomhed, sÃ¥ er det en vigtig historie. Det kan vi ikke sidde overhÃ¸rigt og derfor har vi skrevet historien om Durvads mail i stedet for at fjerne ham fra artiklerne.

I august forlod Kristian Niss organisationen. Han var leder af den nordjyske â€˜redeâ€™, som NMR kalder sine lokalafdelinger. Det skete samtidig med at det svenske medie Expo kunne afslÃ¸re, at en stor gruppe NMR-medlemmer var brudt ud af organisationen og i stedet havde dannet Nordisk Styrke, en angiveligt endnu mere voldsberedt organisation.
Om Niss er gÃ¥et ind i Nordisk Styrke er uklart, men en dansker, der ihvertfald har tilsluttet sig dem er Peter KjÃ¸ller Bak. Den unge fynbo har igennem det seneste Ã¥r ellers vÃ¦ret en af de mest aktive NMR-medlemmer, men har altsÃ¥ forladt organisationen nu.
For to uger siden skete de antisemitiske propaganda- og hÃ¦rvÃ¦rksaktioner sÃ¥ og fÃ¥ dage senere blev Jacob Vullum Andersen fÃ¦ngslet. Efter Kristian Nissâ€™ afgang var Vullum den ene af kun to tilbagevÃ¦rende redeledere i NMR og er nu sat ud af spil indtil han bliver lÃ¸sladt.
Med ovenstÃ¥ende in mente er Martin Durvad sÃ¥ledes den eneste fungerende redeleder â€“ han styrer de kÃ¸benhavnske tropper â€“ samtidig med at han er den Ã¸verste landsleder af den danske afdeling. Indtil nu.
Med mailen til Redox og den hastige sletteaktivitet pÃ¥ NMRâ€™s hjemmeside vil Durvad skrive sig selv ud af NMRâ€™s historie.
Durvad efterlader sig en organisation, der pÃ¥ kort tid er imploderet fuldstÃ¦ndigt: Tre ud af tre redeledere, den ene tillige landsleder, er vÃ¦k. Flere medlemmer stÃ¥r overfor retssager og offentlighedens sÃ¸gelys hviler ubÃ¸nhÃ¸rligt pÃ¥ organisationen. DrÃ¸mmen om de store nazimarcher er parkeret for en rum tid fremover.
Redox har vÃ¦ret i telefonisk kontakt med Peter Bak. Han lagde pÃ¥. Kristian Niss Ã¸nskede ikke at svare pÃ¥ Redoxâ€™ spÃ¸rgsmÃ¥l. Redox har haft en lÃ¦ngere telefonsamtale med Martin Durvad om sagen. Han bekrÃ¦fter, at han trÃ¦kker sig fra NMR, men han Ã¸nsker ikke at stille op til interview.

Du kan stÃ¸tte vores fortsatte arbejde med at afdÃ¦kke den yderste hÃ¸jreflÃ¸j ved at give en donation pÃ¥ Mobilepay: 80905 eller ved at bliveÂ stÃ¸ttemedlem.

Det sker som direkte konsekvens af fÃ¦ngslingen af Jacob Vullum Andersen efter forrige weekends omfattende aktioner mod jÃ¸der i Danmark. Der â€¦

content:

Citatet handlede om indrejseforbud i USA til personer fra specifikke muslimske lande. Og vi var dumme nok til at hoppe med pÃ¥ idÃ©en! Men der var masser af penge at tjene for vÃ¥benindustrien.â€
Udover at vÃ¦re folketingskandidat for Nye Borgerlige spiller Philip Brandt en central rolle i partiets lokale organisation pÃ¥ Bornholm, hvor han er en drivende kraft i partiets lokalafdeling og bestyrelse.
Philip Brandt argumenterede i kommentar til hans eget opslag for at angrebet pÃ¥ World Trade Center den 11. september 2001, var et â€œinside-jobâ€. Screenshot.

Her lÃ¸d det klare svar fra folketingskandidaten: â€Homoseksuelles â€œretâ€ til at blive gift i en kirke er efter min mening et decideret overgreb pÃ¥ kirkenâ€,Â Â

Denne artikel er en del af vores dÃ¦kning af Folketingsvalget 2019, hvor vi gransker Nye Borgerlige og Stram Kurs. Du kan sende os tips pÃ¥ email, Signal eller Facebook.
Hvis du vil stÃ¸tte vores arbejde Ã¸konomisk kan du gÃ¸re det pÃ¥ Mobilepay 80905, ved at blive stÃ¸ttemedlem eller med en bankoverfÃ¸rsel.

Mens Philip Brandt i 2017 mente, at homovielser var et â€œdecideret overgreb pÃ¥ kirkenâ€, lÃ¸d der den 22. september 2016 andre toner fra Nye Borgerliges partiformand, Pernille Vermund, da hun adspurgt af en lÃ¦ser af Ekstra Bladet udtalte:Â â€œVi mener, at det er op til kirken at bestemme, hvem de vil vie og ikke vie. Men hvis man ikke kan se pÃ¥ to personer af samme kÃ¸n kysse, sÃ¥ skal man ikke komme til Danmark.â€

title: Internationalt drama i Generation IdentitÃ¦r
content:
I den forgangne uge afholdte Generation IdentitÃ¦r deres internationale sommerlejr i Frankrig, blandt andet med deltagelse af en delegation fra den danske afdeling.
Indholdet pÃ¥ sommerlejren, der bliver kaldt for et â€œsommeruniversitetâ€, bestod bl.a. forelÃ¦sninger, aktionstrÃ¦ning og kampsport. Ugen i Sydfrankrig forlÃ¸b dog ikke problemfrit, da et af de ledende britiske medlemmer angiveligt forlod lejren i protest mod at et andet medlem tidligere har vÃ¦ret involveret i et racistisk motiveret knivoverfald.
Under lejren kontaktede det engelske medie The Observer nemlig en rÃ¦kke ledende medlemmer af den engelske afdeling og foreholdt dem oplysninger om at et prominent medlem havde naziforbindelser og havde vÃ¦ret tiltalt for et racistisk knivoverfald. Oplysningerne fik den ene de to britiske ledere, Tom DuprÃ©, til at forlade lejren og organisationen. I den forbindelse udtalte han blandt andet at oplysningerne ville â€œskabe kaosâ€ i sommerlejren og at hans vurdering var, at andre medlemmer ogsÃ¥ ville forlade organisationen.
Norsk nazivold
I fÃ¸lge Redoxâ€™ oplysninger omhandlede de kontroversielle oplysninger nordmanden Tore Johan Rasmussen, der indtil fornyligt var bosiddende i England og har haft en central rolle i opbygningen af den engelske afdeling af Generation IdentitÃ¦r. Ved organisationens konference â€œEuropean Reunionâ€, der blev afholdt i april 2018 udenfor London, var han konferencier. Desuden driver han webshoppen â€œPhalanx Europaâ€, der er tilknyttet Generation IdentitÃ¦r.
Den danske talsperson for Generation IdentitÃ¦r, Aurelija Aniulyte, ses her ved den engelske konference i april. (Foto: Researchkollektivet Redox)
I marts 2000 blev Tore Johan Rasmussen anholdt og fÃ¦ngslet sammen med syv andre uniformerede nazister i Stavanger. Det skete efter at personer i gruppen en fredag nat umotiveret havde overfaldet to mÃ¦nd, den ene fra Algeriet, med knive, brosten, slag og spark. Det ene offer blev bl.a. stukket med kniv i skridtet, mens det andet blev tildelt otte knivstik, hvilket bl.a. resulterede i en punkteret lunge. Nazisterne var i Stavanger for at uddele lÃ¸besedler fra den amerikanske nazigruppe National Alliance, der bl.a. opfordrede til at Â«redde den hvide raceÂ». Ved retsagen blev Tore Johan Rasmussen som den eneste af de otte tiltalte frikendt. Han erkendte at have vÃ¦ret tilstede under overfaldet og fortalte desuden, at det var ham, der havde medbragt de nazistiske lÃ¸besedler.
Rasmussen blev i maj 2018 nÃ¦gtet indrejse i England pÃ¥ grund af sit engagement i Generation IdentitÃ¦r. I den forbindelse medvirkede han i flere interviews, hvor han bekrÃ¦ftede sine nazistiske aktiviteter og sympatier i Norge.
Intern konflikt
Mens den ene af de to britiske ledere altsÃ¥ har taget afstand fra Tore Johan Rasmussen, sÃ¥ stÃ¸tter resten af organisationen op om ham. Den britiske Generation IdentitÃ¦r-afdeling skriver pÃ¥ Twitter: â€œMennesker laver fejl, isÃ¦r nÃ¥r de lukkes ude af det politiske etablissement og stemples som kÃ¦ttere. Tore Rasmussen har altid vÃ¦re Ã¦rlig om sin fortid og, vigtigst, hvordan han overvandt den.â€
PÃ¥ Twitter proklamerer den britiske afdeling ogsÃ¥, at Tom DuprÃ© ikke forlod sommerlejren i protest, men blev smidt ud for â€œflere tilfÃ¦lde af problematisk opfÃ¸rselâ€, samt at han i forvejen stod til eksklusion fra hele organisationen. Den Ã¸strigske leder for Generation IdentitÃ¦r, Martin Sellner, skriver desuden pÃ¥ Twitter, at det var ham som smed Tom DuprÃ© ud fra lejren, efter at DuprÃ© havde smuglet alkohol ind, samt at dette skete dagen fÃ¸r knivoverfald og nazisme blev et tema.
Tom DuprÃ© skrev lÃ¸rdag pÃ¥ Twitter, at han sÃ¸ndag ville komme med en udtalelse vedrÃ¸rende hans exit fra Generation IdentitÃ¦r. Det var dog ikke sket ved redaktionens afslutning. Tore Johan Rasmussen svarede DuprÃ©, at han hÃ¥bede, at DuprÃ© â€œvil indrÃ¸mme, at vores forskelligeheder var i strategi, ikke ideologiâ€.
Det har ikke vÃ¦ret muligt at fÃ¥ en kommentar fra den danske talsperson for Generation IdentitÃ¦r, Aurelija Aniulyte.

title: Redox sender rapport om Danskernes Parti ud til lokalpolitikere
content:
For fÃ¸rste gang siden BesÃ¦ttelsen 1940-45 er det den 19. november i Danmark muligt i store dele af landet at sÃ¦tte et kryds ved et nazistisk parti. Selvom Danskernes Parti ikke er i nÃ¦rheden af at fÃ¥ valgt dets kandidater ind i kommunalbestyrelser og regionsrÃ¥d, ser Researchkollektivet Redox stadig partiets opstilling som en bekymrende udvikling. IsÃ¦r set i lyset af erfaringerne fra vores nabolande Tyskland og Sverige, hvor nynazister fra Danskernes Partis sÃ¸sterpartier, NPD og Svenskarnas Parti, de seneste Ã¥r har haft held med at fÃ¥ valgt deres kandidater ind i byrÃ¥d og delstatsparlamenter.
Redox vil gerne imÃ¸degÃ¥ udviklingen og bidrage til at sikre en fornuftig og kvalificeret debat af nazismens nye ansigt i Danmark og de potentielle trusler mod den demokratiske udvikling, som den udgÃ¸r. Derfor har Redox nu sendt et trykt eksemplar af Demokratiske nazister, der handler om Danskernes Parti, ud til samtlige etablerede partier i de fem kommuner, hvor partiet stiller op til valg.
â€Vi har valgt at sende vores rapport ud til hele det politiske spektrum lige fra Enhedslisten til Dansk Folkeparti i KÃ¸benhavn, SÃ¸nderborg, Fredericia, Ã…rhus og HjÃ¸rring. Det har vi gjort for at give politikerne og deres bagland ude lokalt de bedste forudsÃ¦tninger for at forstÃ¥ og tage stilling til Danskernes Partiâ€, udtaler Simon BÃ¼nger, ansvarshavende redaktÃ¸r for Redox.dk.
Redox udgav i starten af september den omfattende undersÃ¸gelse og dokumentation af Danskernes Parti netop for at opkvalificere debatten om partiet, og for at give samfundet et vÃ¦rktÃ¸j til at forstÃ¥ og imÃ¸degÃ¥ truslen fra den moderne nynazisme. Det gÃ¦lder ogsÃ¥ de mange lokalpolitikere, der i lÃ¸bet af valgkampen har mÃ¸dt og kommer til at mÃ¸de Danskernes Parti pÃ¥ gaden og til vÃ¦lgermÃ¸der.
Det er Redoxâ€™ klare vurdering, at Danskernes Parti fÃ¸rst og fremmest stiller op til valget den 19. november for at opnÃ¥ en politisk legitimitet i samfundet. Derudover Ã¸nsker partiet at bruge valget som platform til at sprede partiets nynazistiske propaganda og hverve nye medlemmer.
â€NÃ¥r Danskernes Parti stiller op til valg og deltager i den politiske debat, f.eks. gennem vÃ¦lgermÃ¸der med de andre partier, sÃ¥ gÃ¸r de det ikke for at diskutere politiske meningsforskelle. Partiets strategi handler om, via demokratiets virkemidler, at vise, at Danskernes Parti er en del af det gode selskab, pÃ¥ trods af dets nazistiske og antidemokratiske politik. Vi Ã¸nsker en bred afstandtagen fra nazisme og fremmedhad til fordel for en sund politisk debat, og vi Ã¸nsker ikke, at valget den 19. november skal bruges af Danskernes Parti som platform til at legitimere deres nynazistiske propagandaâ€, siger Simon BÃ¼nger.
Selvom Danskernes Parti ikke har mange chancer for at fÃ¥ valgt sine kandidater ind i kommunalbestyrelserne eller regionsrÃ¥dene, er det Redoxâ€™ opfattelse, at Danskernes Parti stadig udgÃ¸r en konkret fare for vores fÃ¦llesskab og for den demokratiske udvikling. Erfaringerne Svenskarnas Parti i Sverige og NPD i Tyskland viser, hvordan nynazister har haft held med, via en pÃ¥ overfladen pÃ¦n og demokratisk indpakning, at vokse sig store â€“ bl.a. gennem aktiv valgdeltagelse. Det skaber foruden legitimitet ogsÃ¥ en stÃ¸rre og stÃ¸rre propaganda- og rekrutteringsplatform, der igen betyder en stÃ¸rre nynazistisk bevÃ¦gelse.
Danskernes Parti har pÃ¥ trods af den pÃ¦ne indpakning, gennem sin medlemsskare og menneskefjendtlige politik, samme voldspotentiale over for politiske modstandere og forskellige minoritetsgrupper, som vi kender det fra den traditionelle nazisme. Det bekrÃ¦ftes af erfaringerne med partiets sÃ¸sterorganisationer i Sverige og Tyskland. Samtidig er flere af Danskernes Partis medlemmer dÃ¸mt for vold, ligesom at hovedparten af kernemedlemmerne kommer fra de ekstremt voldsberedte organisationer DNSB, Danmarks Nationale Front og White Pride.
â€Det er vigtigt for os, at Danskernes Parti ikke blot bliver affejet som endnu en gruppe forskruede landsbytosser, men at lokalpolitikerne tager problematikken med deres indtog pÃ¥ den parlamentariske arena alvorligt, fÃ¸r problemet vokser sig stort. Vi mÃ¸der ofte den holdning, at der mÃ¥ vÃ¦re plads til nazisme i et demokratisk samfund. Til det mÃ¥ jeg blot sige, at nazismen allerede en gang har vist os, hvordan den opererer i et demokratisk samfundâ€, udtaler Simon BÃ¼nger og fortsÃ¦tter:
â€I sidste ende handler nazisme ikke om holdninger, men om handlinger. Og nazisternes handlinger er, uanset indpakning, i sidste ende voldelige og antidemokratiske.â€
Danskernes Parti stiller op i de fem kommuner KÃ¸benhavn, SÃ¸nderborg, Fredericia, Ã…rhus og HjÃ¸rring og i alle regioner pÃ¥ nÃ¦r Region SjÃ¦lland. Oprindeligt var det ogsÃ¥ partiets intention at stille op i BrÃ¸ndby Kommune, men her lykkedes det ikke for kandidaten Thomas Berg SÃ¸rensen og hans partifÃ¦ller at indsamle de 50 underskrifter, der er nÃ¸dvendige for at kunne stille op.
Du kan lÃ¦se meget mere om Danskernes Parti her
excerpt: For fÃ¸rste gang siden BesÃ¦ttelsen 1940-45 er det den 19. november i Danmark muligt i store dele af landet at sÃ¦tte et kryds ved et nazistisk parti. Selvom Danskernes Parti ikke er i nÃ¦rheden af at fÃ¥ valgt dets kandidater ind i kommunalbestyrelser og regionsrÃ¥d, ser Researchkollektivet Redox stadig partiets opstilling som en bekymrende udvikling. â€¦

Bar-ejer: Thrane er her som gÃ¦st

Screenshot fra Facebook.

Derefter afbrÃ¸d hun samtalen og afviste Redoxâ€™ opfÃ¸lgende opkald.
Redox ringede efterfÃ¸lgende til Carsten Thrane, der i fÃ¸rste omgang afviste at have oprettet et vagtvÃ¦rn. Han siger til Redox, at han er kommet pÃ¥ NÃ¸rrebro i mange Ã¥r og at han kommer meget pÃ¥ L.A.TINO, fordi han godt kan lide stedet.
Kort tid efter den fÃ¸rste samtale, der varede mere end 20 minutter, ringede Carsten Thrane tilbage til Redox. Han sagde, at bevogtning â€œer en politiopgave.â€

title: New antimuslim party heading for Danish parliament while neofascists and anti-Semites take it to the streets
content:
Within the next couple of months, Denmark will elect new members of parliament. After more than 23 years of being the most right-wing party in parliament, Dansk Folkeparti (Danish Peopleâ€™s Party) is at risk of being overtaken by Nye Borgerlige (â€œNyeâ€ meaning â€œnewâ€, â€œBorgerligeâ€ being a Danish catch-all word for centre-right ideologies, conservative or liberal). Nye Borgerlige was founded in 2015 and is headed by architect and former conservative politician Pernille Vermund. The party has even more anti-immigrant and anti-Muslim policies than Dansk Folkeparti, but at the same time represents the most liberal economical view in Danish politics.
The party is one of several new organisations in the Danish far right movement. With the elections just around the corner, itâ€™s time for an overview of a movement which is looking to strengthen itself on the streets and in the parliament. Weâ€™ll do it in English for our international readers.
The architect and her biggest project
In autumn of 2015, a small group of former members of the Danish Conservative Party announced that they were forming a new party. The decision was based on growing frustrations with what they perceived as a soft stance on immigration, refugees and integration in the Conservative Party. Nye Borgerlige started gathering the 20.000 signatures required to run for parliament. They succeeded in less than a year, gaining media attention and several thousand new members.
In two aspects Nye Borgerlige is the most radical right-wing party in Danish politics: The line towards immigrants, refugees and Muslims is by far the most extreme. The other aspect is economic ideas, where the party represents the most ultraliberal standpoint seen in Danish politics for several decades, planning to lower taxes and drastically reduce the public sector.
Pernille Vermund and vice chairman Peter Seier Christensen at a press conference.
Even though Dansk Folkeparti is one of the most successful far right populist parties of Europe, the growth of Nye Borgerlige is a sign of a general tendency in Danish politics. Not only the centre-right, but also the Social Democrats and to some extent the Socialist Peopleâ€™s Party, has adapted a populist view on matters regarding immigrants, Muslims and refugees in a historic rightward turn, leaving only far left and humanist parties as a small but vocal antiracist opposition in the parliament.
Nye Borgerlige is in many ways a heterogeneous organization. While many of the candidates and leading members have a background in other parliamentary centre-right parties, the party has attracted a lot of rank and file members from the extreme right. Even though the leadership comes from the centre-right Conservative Party, they also have political affiliations to the national conservative movement growing out of the large scene of right-wing blogs and alternative news sites. This was clearly demonstrated this winter, when journalists from Redox posing as undercover sympathizers of Nye Borgerlige tried to gain membership claiming to have a background in, the now defunct neo-nazi party, Danskernes Parti (Party of the Danes). 10 out of 10 local chairs in Nye Borgerlige gladly accepted the former members of the neo-nazi party.
Due to the many ties to even more far right organizations, the party has often been forced to expel members when theyâ€™ve been exposed as holocaust deniers or being too forward with their racist opinions. However, the leadership around Pernille Vermund is also very conscious not to expel every member who gets negative attention in the media or on social media, that would likely create too many internal conflicts. As of now the party seems to have found a middle ground where only the most controversial get expelled. However, the leadership might be forced to make even more expulsions as the election closes in and the media starts investigating members and candidates of the party.
Most polls place Nye Borgerlige above the two percent-limit, which is the minimum for getting a seat in parliament. Some polls are dangerously close to the limit, while others place the party around five percent.
Should the party succeed at gaining a seat in parliament, they might end up tipping the scale in favour of the right, giving current Prime Minister Lars LÃ¸kke Rasmussen four more years as head of government. However, this comes at a price. Nye Borgerlige has set up three non-negotiable demands for them to support a government run by Lars LÃ¸kke Rasmussen: A complete stop for giving asylum in Denmark, all foreigners in Denmark must be self-supporting and all foreigners will be expelled if convicted of a crime, no matter the severity. For now, it seems unrealistic that the Prime Minister would give in to all three demands.
The YouTube-warrior Rasmus Paludan
Another new phenomenon in Denmark is the lawyer turned party leader turned Youtube celebrity: Rasmus Paludan. With a background in the centre-right in his younger years, he was mostly known for his website where he exposed people driving their bikes on the pavement or jaywalking. He became a lawyer writing hostile poems about the police, curiously also one protesting the demolishment of the left radical Youth House in NÃ¸rrebro, which was torn down in 2007.
In 2015 he participated in a right-wing demonstration in Copenhagen organized by the local Pegida-inspired network. This was the start of a rapid radicalization process leading him to start his own media, â€œThe Voice of Freedomâ€, and a political party called â€œStram Kursâ€ (Hard Line). He started organizing small demonstrations with two to five participants in front of left-wing spaces, often resulting in him being ridiculed with humoristic banners and at one point being drenched with a bucket of what he claimed to be urine. After the long campaign against the Copenhagen left-wing scene with no outcome and abysmal election results at the municipal elections in 2017, Rasmus Paludan changed his focus.
Rasmus Paludan (blue jacket) at a rightwing demonstration in Copenhagen.
Throughout 2018 he has been gathering signatures to run for parliament. At the time of writing, he has less than a quarter of the required 20.000 signatures. With elections being held at latest in June this year, he is pressed for time to get the missing signatures. This has driven him to become more provocative in his actions. From touring so-called â€˜ghetto areasâ€™, calling the residents â€œcriminal losersâ€ and protesting, in his words, â€˜homo Islamâ€™, things have escalated lately. After many threats to do so, he had a supporter burn a Quran after smearing it with bacon, while being protected by the police at a small demonstration this February. This is, for now, the latest from the lawyer who enjoys massive police protection every time he shows up to provoke the people he despises.
Even though Paludan is seen as brave by many on the far right, he has never succeeded building his party nor building a strong political group around him. Most of his followers online are teens and pre-teens, who favour his eccentric attitude but do not support him or his project. Despite many thousand weekly views on his YouTube videos he is politically isolated, even on the far right.
Bombmakers coming to Denmark
While the national conservative movement is joining the ranks of Nye Borgerlige, the extraparliamentary movements of the traditional national socialists and the neofascists are also gaining traction. In the last couple of years, the Danish fascist movement has been reshaped, since the crash in 2017 of the largest neo-Nazi party, Danskernes Parti. Two new organizations are dominating: the neofascist Generation IdentitÃ¦r, a part of the European identitarian movement of the same name, and the openly national socialist Nordic Resistance Movement.
We will start with the latter. The Nordic Resistance Movement, abbreviated NMR, was formed in Sweden. The last decade the group has seen successful expansions to Finland and Norway. An early attempt to organize in Denmark failed due to poor leadership.

Support us!
Did you know that you can support us financially even though you donâ€™t reside in Denmark? 
If you join our Supportersâ€™ Collective, you will take part of financing our investigative journalism. 
Every month you pay a fixed amount between 50 and 500 Danish kroner (between 8 and 77 USD or between 7 and 67 euro). We accept Visa, Mastercard, American Express and most of other major debit/credit cards. 

Meanwhile, the parent organization in Sweden has also changed. From being a small sectarian part of the Swedish far right, the group is now the most dominant of the street active organizations. They are also the most violent, being involved in several attempted murders, knife attacks and a series of bomb plantings at refugee centers and a left-wing bookstore. Members of the organization have also been convicted of murder.
Now the militant group, by experts deemed as terrorists, has relaunched in Denmark. Over the last years the organization has stabilized with three local groups and very continuous activities. The activities range from putting up stickers and posters to banner actions on highway bridges and symbolic actions â€œclosing offâ€ disliked places using barrier tape. This was done to a cafÃ© run by the LGBT-movement in Odense and a statue remembering the rebel Queen Mary who led the rebellion against the Danish colonizers on the isle of St. Croix in the Caribbean Sea in 1878. The group has also made campaigns against the so-called â€œgay lobbyâ€ and with openly antisemitic and holocaust-denying messages.
Since last summer the organization has started doing continuous street actions, normally on Saturdays, standing in the central streets of typically provincial towns, handing out leaflets for a few hours, afterwards publishing â€˜action videosâ€™ of the activities, with heroic music. NMR has also participated in demonstrations organized by the Swedish and Finnish divisions several times.
For now, the level of militancy in the Danish division is lower than in Norway, Finland and Sweden, but it is also still the youngest and smallest division.
Nazis from NMR in Sweden at a march in Gothenburg.
On a positive note, the rise of NMR has enhanced the decline of two other national socialist organizations, The National Front of Denmark (DNF) and The National Socialist Movement of Denmark (DNSB). Whereas the DNF is a skinhead movement arising out the neo-Nazi Danish Front in the middle of the last decade, the DNSB is the traditional NS-party with historical ties to the Danish Nazi party during World War II. Neither of the two organizations have had an active leadership for several years and exist only through their name and a few, secret social gatherings each year. The amount of outward activities is close to zero. The DNSB still has a small headquarter in Greve, 25 kilometers southwest of Copenhagen, but the large parties and concerts are history for now.
Neofascist hipsters with French inspiration
The other far right group on the rise in Denmark is Generation IdentitÃ¦r. The group was formed in 2017 and has gained large support from the national conservative movement due to simple symbolic actions presented as cool, visually effective videos and pictures on social media. The actions are inspired by the other European divisions of the original French organization Generation Identitaire: A group of 8-10 activists, dressed casually, placed near a busy street or square with a large banner, perhaps supplemented by flares and/or shouting of slogans for a few minutes. After a quick exit, the real traction is gained on social media, when videos of the actions are shared. For the Danish division, even a simple banner action will get several hundreds of likes and shares and get momentum online.
The Danish Generation IdentitÃ¦r has an official age limit of 30 years. Most of the members are in their mid-twenties, typically studying or having just completed higher educations. GI has two local groups, one in Copenhagen and one in Aarhus, and most of their activities are confined to these two cities. However, GI is often participating in activities in other European countries organized by local divisions of the organization.
Danish identitarians demonstrate in support of Tommy Robinson.
As of now both NMR and Generation IdentitÃ¦r are still small in terms of members. But both organizations have successfully launched local chapters and are, in their own ways, establishing themselves as the two go-to places for new supporters wanting to join a far right organization. If Nye Borgerlige fails in the elections, or if the Social Democrats regain power, the frustrations on the far right can easily lead to a rapid growth in the street-oriented neofascist and national socialist organizations. Regardless of the election results 2019 will reshape the far right in Denmark.
If you want to see more investigative reporting on the danish far right you can join our Supporterâ€™s Collective to fund our research.

Bogen er desvÃ¦rre heller ikke specielt velskrevet. Den har dog sine momenter, hvor den fanger og man bliver draget med ind i fortÃ¦llingen. Igennem hele bogen skinner det tydeligt igennem, at Thomas Vestergaard meget gerne vil lÃ¦gge afstand til sin fortid. Det kommer f.eks. til udtryk i omtalen af DNSBÂ´s politiske modstandere, der fortsat kaldes â€de rÃ¸deâ€, en yndet udtryksform om politiske modstandere hos hÃ¸jreradikale.

Han skriver; â€Demonstrationen bliver udlagt som en succes af begge parter. IsÃ¦r af os.â€ Dagen var ifÃ¸lge Thomas Vestergaard og DNSB en succes fordi det lykkedes, at gennemfÃ¸re en demonstration og fordi der angiveligt var 14 moddemonstranter, der endte pÃ¥ hospitalet. Et af de medlemmer, der boede i huset, er blevet smidt ud pÃ¥ grund af et hashmisbrug, og magtbegÃ¦r, mistro og intriger har nÃ¦sten lagt huset Ã¸de.â€
I 1995 var Thoms Frausing Vestergaard en del af DNSBâ€™s inderkerne. Her ses han i forbindelse med deres Hess-march i Roskilde. (Foto: privat)

Intriger og mistro lader i det hele taget til at have vÃ¦ret en omfattende del af partilivet i DNSB. Thomas Vestergaard beskriver sÃ¥ledes flere steder, hvordan det at vÃ¦re fast mand i Greve kunne fÃ¸re til et hÃ¸jt stressniveau. Der kunne vÃ¦re mange Ã¥rsager til mistro og intriger. Et eksempel udspillede sig pÃ¥ Thomas Vestergaards fÃ¸dselsdag. Han har i den anledning lavet lagkage, men ifÃ¸lge Vestergaard ville ingen spise af den fÃ¸r han selv havde taget en bid. Snakken gik pÃ¥ om han villeâ€forgive demâ€.
Et andet eksempel: Jonni Hansen fÃ¥r pÃ¥ et tidspunkt en kÃ¦reste, hvilket ifÃ¸lge Thomas Vestergaard fÃ¥r sladderen til at eksplodere i nazibunkeren. Flere mener antageligt, at â€â€¦ hun gÃ¥r i lidt for store sko, samt at hun fÃ¥r lov at blande sig i alt for meget.â€ Thomas Vestergaard skriver efterfÃ¸lgende, at DNSBÂ´s davÃ¦rende nÃ¦stformand, der ogsÃ¥ er redaktÃ¸r pÃ¥ partiavisen FÃ¦drelandet, forlader DNSB sammen med andre medlemmer. Hvor nogen falder fra bliver der plads til nye og Thomas Vestergaard kan sÃ¥ledes rykke frem i hierarkiet. Han fÃ¥r Ã¸genavnet â€Skyggenâ€, fordi han loyalt fÃ¸lger Jonni Hansen i tykt og tyndt, hvilket belÃ¸nnes med en redaktÃ¸rpost pÃ¥ FÃ¦drelandet og senere bliver han desuden pressechef i DNSB.
I perioden bor Thomas Vestergaard i Greve og bliver der samlet i fem Ã¥r. DesvÃ¦rre er der heller ikke her blevet plads til overvejelser over hvad hans egen indsats for DNSB har betydet for organisationen og dets udvikling i de fem Ã¥r han boede i huset.
Thomas Vestergaard beskriver en hÃ¦ndelse i forbindelse med en demonstration, hvor Jonni Hansen bliver anholdt og â€politiet tÃ¦ver lÃ¸s pÃ¥ ham med knippelslag, og hans hÃ¸jre knÃ¦skal flÃ¦kker.â€ Det Ã¦ndrer angiveligt Jonni Hansen mentalt. Han bliver mere aggressiv som fÃ¸lge af smerter og medicin.
Det interessante er ikke politiets behandling af Jonni Hansen, men at tiden bagefter fÃ¸rer til en mere â€grÃ¥ og hÃ¥rdâ€ tone i Greve, og i sidste ende er det begyndelsen pÃ¥ enden for Jonni Hansens tid som leder af DNSB. Han mister kampgejsten og â€begynder at snakke om at trÃ¦kke sig tilbage. Han er brugt op, og har ingen lyst til at kÃ¦mpe for sagen lÃ¦ngere. Et helt liv i modvind sÃ¦tter sine tydelige ar pÃ¥ bÃ¥de krop og sjÃ¦l.â€
Jonni Hansens exit vender vi tilbage til.
VÃ¥ben og vold
Thomas Vestergaard beskriver ogsÃ¥, hvordan han via sin vÃ¥benhandlende far, tidligt stiftede bekendtskab med skydevÃ¥ben. Derfor er det mÃ¥ske heller ikke sÃ¥ overraskende det fÃ¸lger ham senere i livet.
Den fÃ¸rste nat Thomas Vestergaard skal sove i huset i Greve er der moddemonstration udenfor. Han beskriver hvordan han med et cricketbat og en kniv er klar til at tage imod demonstranterne, hvis de skulle formÃ¥ at forcere hegnet.
Det er dog langt fra den eneste episode, hvor vÃ¥ben spiller en rolle for Thomas Vestergaard og hans engagement i DNSB. Han beskriver en episode, hvor han bliver konfronteret med hans nazistiske ideer i Brugsen: â€Jeg trÃ¦kker op i min bluse, bag mit hagekorsbÃ¦ltespÃ¦nde sidder der en pistol, og det fÃ¥r dem til at stoppe op.â€
DesvÃ¦rre er der ingen nÃ¦rmere forklaring fra Thomas Vestergaard pÃ¥, hvorvidt det var almindeligt for DNSB-medlemmer at bÃ¦re skydevÃ¥ben, men det har tilsyneladende ikke vÃ¦ret lÃ¦ngere vÃ¦k end at en tur i Brugsen kunne vÃ¦re anledning til at tage et skydevÃ¥ben med sig. Det kunne have givet bogen en del mere styrke, hvis en episode som denne var blevet uddybet og reflekteret over, men desvÃ¦rre genfortÃ¦ller han bare episoden og siger, at han bagefter var skrÃ¦mt over sit eget had.
VÃ¥ben kan dog vÃ¦re andet end knive og pistoler. Det kan ogsÃ¥ vÃ¦re en bil. Det blev tydeligt en skÃ¦bnesvanger morgen i Greve, hvor Jonni Hansen bevidst pÃ¥kÃ¸rer antinazistiske demonstranter udenfor nazibunkeren. Flere skades alvorligt.
Da beskeden nÃ¥r de sovende nazister i huset bevÃ¦bner de sig og stormer ud pÃ¥ gaden uden at finde nogen eller noget. Det er imidlertid ikke skaderne pÃ¥ demonstranterne, der bekymrer Thomas Vestergaard. Det fÃ¥r ingen omtale. Derimod omtales de skader, der var i hegnet efter aktionen. Faktisk fÃ¥r man det indtryk, at Thomas Vestergaard mener det var et uheld Jonni Hansen pÃ¥kÃ¸rte folk den morgen; â€Jonni ser ingen anden udvej end at jokke speederen i bund og kÃ¸re tvÃ¦rs igennem dem, men det lykkes ikke helt, og et par af angriberne bliver ramt af bilenâ€. Igen savnes der et kritisk blik pÃ¥ pÃ¥kÃ¸rslen og mÃ¥ske en tanke om hvorfor retten efterfÃ¸lgende idÃ¸mte Jonni Hansen en lÃ¦ngere fÃ¦ngselsstraf.
PÃ¥ et tidspunkt flytter Thomas Vestergaard til Ã…rhus. Hans politiske mission i Ã…rhus er, ifÃ¸lge ham selv, at fÃ¥ etableret en afdeling af DNSB i byen samt etablere kontakt til White Pride. White Pride er en nazistisk hooligangruppe med tilknytning AGF. Thomas Vestergaard nÃ¦vner intet om, at DNSB skulle have et problem med White Prides vanlige vold, men at problemet snarere var, at White Pride â€ikke interesserer sig den mindste smule for politikâ€, men bare gerne vil slÃ¥s, se fodbold og lave ballade uanset hvem det sÃ¥ mÃ¥tte vÃ¦re imod. Derfor er de efter Thomas Vestergaards opfattelse â€uegnedeâ€ som DNSB medlemmer. Igen kunne bogen havde vÃ¦ret betragtelig stÃ¦rkere, hvis Thomas Vestergaard havde haft et lidt stÃ¸rre kendskab til White Pride, deres historie og mÃ¥l samt forholdt sig til hvilken type organisation de er, men desvÃ¦rre sker det ikke.
Jonni Hansen forlader DNSB
Det mest interessante afsnit handler om Jonni Hansens afgang som formand og det efterfÃ¸lgende drama for at finde hans aflÃ¸ser. I DR3-udsendelsen â€Mit had til skrÃ¦k og advarselâ€ fra 2016 udtalte Thomas Vestergaard, at grunden til han ikke blev formand, selvom han pÃ¥ det tidpsunkt var nÃ¦stformand var, at â€â€¦ det havde han ikke lyst til.â€ Det er forklaring han delvist fastholder i bogen, hvor han skriver; â€Er det nu ogsÃ¥ det, jeg vil? Skal jeg vÃ¦re formand for sÃ¥dan en organisation?â€ og antyder dermed, at han var i tvivl om hvorvidt han havde lyst til at blive formand.
Det forekommer dog som en sÃ¸gt forklaring, som skrives i bagklogskabens klare lys. Det bliver ret tydeligt, nÃ¥r man sammenligner det med den fÃ¸rstehÃ¥ndsberetning han selv giver om magtkampen, der udspillede sig i DNSB efter Jonni Hansens afgang. IfÃ¸lge Thomas Vestergaard indkalder Jonni Hansen til ekstraordinÃ¦rt mÃ¸de, hvor deltagerne tror, at de skal diskutere strategi i forhold til det kommende kommunalvalg. Det viser sig dog, at dagsordenen er formandens afgang og at mÃ¸dedeltagerne skal finde hans aflÃ¸ser.
Det kommer som et lyn fra en klar himmel for de forsamlede nazister. Ikke desto mindre gennemfÃ¸res mÃ¸det og nÃ¥r frem til to kandidater; Thomas Vestergaard og Esben Rohde Kristensen. De to ser forskelligt pÃ¥ tingene og det bliver tilsyneladende tydeligt pÃ¥ mÃ¸det, hvor forfatteren, siger at han: â€â€¦ taler min sag, sÃ¥ godt jeg kan, men lige lidt hjÃ¦lper det.â€
Thomas Vestergaard kÃ¦mpede altsÃ¥ for magten i DNSB og er da ogsÃ¥ â€skuffetâ€ over udfaldet af diskussionen. IfÃ¸lge ham selv var Ã¥rsagen til nederlaget, at han er pensioneret â€og man kan ikke have en syg person som formand for DNSBâ€, som argumentet lÃ¸d, men ogsÃ¥ hans stigende fravÃ¦r i Greve spillede ind. Ikke desto mindre forbliver han som nÃ¦stformand. Det hÃ¦nger dÃ¥rligt sammen manglende lyst.
I mÃ¥nederne efter Jonni Hansens bratte exit udspiller der sig et internt drama af de store i DNSB. Mistro, intriger og magtbegÃ¦r kammer over og ender med at understrege den voldskultur, der hele tiden er lige under overfladen i DNSB. Det udvikler sig til et sandt â€helvedeâ€ i nazibunkeren de nÃ¦ste tre mÃ¥neder; â€Ensretning, mistro og intriger fylder hele atmosfÃ¦renâ€, fortÃ¦ller Thomas Vestergaard og det ekstremt dÃ¥rlige miljÃ¸ kulminere med at Thomas Vestergaard, sammen med hans allierede â€Tommyâ€, bliver beskyldt for at ville kuppe sig til magten i DNSB.
Det har konsekvenser i nazistiske kredse og der bliver sendt â€fem-seks ind pÃ¥ kontoret bevÃ¦bnede med kÃ¸llerâ€ for at forhindre det pÃ¥stÃ¥ede kup. Heldigvis for Thomas Vestergaard var han var gÃ¥et tidligt den dag. EfterfÃ¸lgende tÃ¸r han ikke tage hjem og bruger et par dage pÃ¥ flugt fra den organisation, som han har hjulpet med at opbygge de sidste 16 Ã¥r. Konflikten slutter med at Thomas Vestergaard indgÃ¥r en aftale med Esben Rohde Kristensen om ikke at offentliggÃ¸re at hans exit fra DNSB fÃ¸r der er gÃ¥et et Ã¥r. PÃ¥ den mÃ¥de slutter nÃ¦sten to Ã¥rtier i hjertet af dansk nazisme for Thomas Vestergaard.
Ikke meget nyt under solen
Bogen slutter af med et horribelt afsnit: â€Hvordan bekÃ¦mper man racismeâ€.
I dette bliver det klart, at Thomas Vestergaard mÃ¥ske nok har lagt sin nazistiske aktivisme pÃ¥ hylden, men at det halter gevaldigt med at slippe de gamle racistiske toner. Selvom afsnittet angiveligt skulle vÃ¦re et afsnit, der vil forklare hvordan man bekÃ¦mper racisme, oser det af fordomme, generaliseringer og en retorik, der ligesÃ¥ godt kunne stamme fra en hÃ¸jreradikal hjemmeside.
F.eks. kaldes flygtninge og indvandrere for â€fremmedeâ€, som ifÃ¸lge Thomas Vestergaard fÃ¥r â€positiv sÃ¦rbehandlingâ€. Hvad det er for en â€positiv sÃ¦rbehandlingâ€ fremgÃ¥r dog ikke, men det skulle ifÃ¸lge forfatteren forklare, hvorfor der er racisme i Danmark.
Folk fra primÃ¦rt muslimske lande betegnes som folk â€der er flere hundrede Ã¥r bagefterâ€ og â€mange af dem har ikke engang set et WC, fÃ¸r de kommer til Danmarkâ€. Derudover bidrager han ogsÃ¥ til myten om at muslimer skulle â€forlange, at danske bÃ¸rn ikke mÃ¥ have kÃ¸d fra grise i madpakkenâ€ og at muslimerne forlanger â€at vi ikke mÃ¥ have offentlige juletrÃ¦erâ€¦ udelukkende af den grund de ikke fejrer jul.â€
Efter de generaliserende pÃ¥stande, slutter Thomas Vestergaard af med ordene â€gensidig respekt er vejen frem.â€
Det krÃ¦ver ikke meget analytisk sans, at nÃ¥ frem til at Thomas Vestergaards forstÃ¥else af hvordan man bekÃ¦mper racisme, bedst gÃ¸res ved at minoriteten assimilerer komplet og lever et liv som flertallet. Analysen og retorikken er en tro kopi af tidens sÃ¥kaldte udlÃ¦ndingedebat og bestemt ikke imponerende fra en, der hÃ¦vder at have lagt racismen pÃ¥ hylden.
For kendere af DNSB bidrager bogen ikke med meget banebrydende nyt. Enkelte nye ting kommer dog frem. SÃ¦rligt beskrivelse af â€kuppetâ€ og den efterfÃ¸lgende flugt er interessant, selvom bogens forfatter har lidt svingende forklaringer pÃ¥ sin egen rolle. Bogen er, pÃ¥ trods af sin noget uortodokse stil, meget nemt lÃ¦st og delene om DNSB har en vis relevans for folk med interesse i det yderste hÃ¸jre.
At lytte til Thomas Vestergaard og hans ideer om hvordan racismen bekÃ¦mpes er ikke nogen god ide. Faktisk lader det til, at han har mere end svÃ¦rt ved helt at slippe den gamle hÃ¸jreradikale jargon, hvilket fortjener en kritisk bemÃ¦rkning nÃ¦ste gang han toner frem i medierne. Der er rigtigt god grund til at stille Thomas Vestergaard kritiske spÃ¸rgsmÃ¥l om hans politiske standpunkt i dag, for de racistiske fordomme har han desvÃ¦rre ikke lagt pÃ¥ hylden.
